articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Tottenham Hotspur are on the hunt for a new manager after Antonio Conte left the club by mutual consent late on Sunday night.
articles.title: Next Spurs manager: Celtic's Ange Postecoglou listed among candidates as early favourite emerges for Tottenham hotseat

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: As the Tartan Army make their pilgrimage to Hampden Park once more on Tuesday night, whether it is from Thurso or Tranent, they will be doing so in hope, and perhaps after a few pints belief, that it is going to be their night. Scotland's night. Finally.
articles.title: Scotland's 6,016 day wait in search of landmark win, Spain threat, Dundee United connection, better than 2006

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Lyndon Dykes is set to lead the forward line for Scotland against Spain on Tuesday after Che Adams withdrew from the squad due to injury.
articles.title: Lyndon Dykes set to lead Scotland line against Spain as John McGinn tipped to join elite club

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Scotland Under-21s were comfortably defeated 3-0 by Wales in a friendly match in Spain on Sunday afternoon.
articles.title: Depleted Scotland Under-21s easily beaten by Wales in final match before Euro 2025 qualifiers

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Daizen Maeda has joined his Celtic team-mate Anthony Ralston in withdrawing from his international team.
articles.title: Celtic forward Daizen Maeda reveals why he has left Japan camp - 'I would rather return to the team'

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Scotland have added Hearts striker Lawrence Shankland to their squad to face Spain on Tuesday.
articles.title: Hearts' Lawrence Shankland makes Scotland squad return as two players drop out for Spain clash

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: It may have seemed relatively low-key but Scotland opening their Euro 2024 qualifying campaign with a 3-0 win over Cyprus at Hampden on Saturday afternoon provoked a few musings.
articles.title: Scotland reaction: Why new strip deserves biggest stage, time for that excitable chatter, Super John McGinn

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: It may have seemed relatively low-key but Scotland opening their Euro 2024 qualifying campaign with a 3-0 win over Cyprus at Hampden on Saturday afternoon provoked a few musings.
articles.title: Scotland reaction: Law, Dalglish…McGinn?; Another 17-year itch that needs scratched; strip pleas

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Spain manager Luis de la Fuente is demanding improvement from his team when they face Scotland on Tuesday despite starting off their Euro 2024 campaign with a 3-0 win over Norway.
articles.title: Spain fire warning to Scotland as ex-Newcastle and Stoke striker becomes unlikely hero against naive Norway

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Raith Rovers are aiming to complete a unique treble as they bid to retain the Scottish Challenge Cup for an incredible third successive time at the Falkirk Stadium this afternoon.
articles.title: Raith Rovers target unique treble as cup bid stirs memories of Hibs v Celtic final for Ian Murray

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Precious few scares ensued for Scotland as they vanquished Cyprus 3-0 in the countries’ Euro 2024 opener at Hampden.
articles.title: 'I got away with it': Angus Gunn relives his Scotland fright despite a perfect day

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: The announcement of a new contract for Steve Clarke 24 hours earlier was not a case of tempting fate, mercifully. Neither was there any reason for the SFA lawyers to scour the small print of the manager’s new deal in search of a get-out clause as Scotland secured an ultimately commanding victory over Cyprus.
articles.title: Scotland's rustiness was to be expected - now race against time is on ahead of crucial Spain clash

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: Steve Clarke made a point of accentuating the positives after Scotland enjoyed a winning start to a European Championships qualifying group for the first time since 2006.
articles.title: Steve Clarke hails 'very pleasing' Scotland win but concerns arise over Che Adams injury

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Perhaps it was the rarefied air of a Scotland home match being played on a Saturday afternoon, but for large parts of this 3-0 win over Cyprus, Hampden was in snooze mode.
articles.title: Lethargic, dozing Hampden tells a story but Scotland victory over Cyprus is ultimately job well done

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Former Rangers manager Steven Gerrard says he had to give Celtic fans “a little bit back” after scoring for Liverpool legends in front of the travelling support during a legends match at Anfield.
articles.title: Steven Gerrard tells Celtic fans 'they can have a bit back' as ex-Rangers boss explains Liverpool celebration

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: We give each of the Scotland players a mark out of ten for their performance against Cyprus in the Euro 2024 qualifier at Hampden ...
articles.title: How the Scotland players rated against Cyprus - the heartstopper, four 6s, one-clear stand-out lands 8

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Former Rangers manager Steven Gerrard had some fun during a charity match for Liverpool against Celtic when he scored the opening goal from the penalty spot.
articles.title: Former Rangers boss Steven Gerrard goads Celtic fans after scoring for Liverpool in charity match

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: A new strip, a new pre-match training base, a new goalkeeper and a manager who admits he agonised over signing a new deal that will – hopefully – take him through to the next World Cup, at least.
articles.title: Steve Clarke addresses John Carver's Oriam rant and goalkeeper question as he looks to mark contract renewal with Cyprus win

articles.author: Damian Spellman
articles.description: Mikey Johnston has not given up on his Celtic career as he continues his battle to feel “important”.
articles.title: Mikey Johnston not giving up on Celtic career after thrilling Ireland debut - 'I just want to feel important'

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: Skipper Andy Robertson has hailed Steve Clarke for mending the relationship between Scotland fans and the team after the manager surprised players with news of his contract extension before training yesterday.
articles.title: How Steve Clarke fixed Scotland as Andy Robertson lifts lid on 'broken' relationship

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: Steve Clarke admits he has surprised himself by signing another new deal as Scotland head coach after fearing he would not last the length of his original contract.
articles.title: 'I would have said no'  - Steve Clarke admits Scotland contract surprise as he addresses possible club football return

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Celtic star Hyeongyu Oh earned his second cap for South Korea, while Daizen Maeda was an unused substitute for Japan.
articles.title: Celtic star Hyeongyu Oh earns 2nd South Korea cap but disappointment for Daizen Maeda

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Steve Clarke has signed a new Scotland deal, keeping him in charge of the national team until after the expanded 2026 World Cup which is being held in Canada, Mexico and United States.
articles.title: Steve Clarke signs new Scotland deal, contract length, SFA chief on 'easiest decision' & 'undeniable progress'

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Former Celtic defender Alan Stubbs has admitted he's have “enjoyed” playing alongside Cameron Carter-Vickers as he compared him to Virgil van Dijk.
articles.title: Celtic star earns Virgil van Dijk comparisons, player of the year claim, impressive stats

articles.author: Chris Andrews
articles.description: The leading chief of the organisers behind the controversial European Super League has revealed he has spoken to clubs in Scotland as the competition targets “domestic kings in less relevant leagues”.
articles.title: ‘Talked to clubs from Scotland' - Celtic and Rangers could land windfall, Super League target 'domestic kings'

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: The resettlement of the Scotland squad to Glasgow that now sees them train at the redeveloped Lesser Hampden has been a boon for Steve Clarke’s national team, insists his assistant John Carver.
articles.title: How Scotland will avoid any spying in their new Lesser Hampden training facility

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Ange Postecoglou will remain at Celtic next season for a crack at the Champions League, reckons former Parkhead star Alan Stubbs.
articles.title: 'Feel he can do that job' - Ange Postecoglou will remain at Celtic claims ex-star and the Rodgers comparison

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Former Hibs boss Alan Stubbs still doesn’t “know why” Celtic failed to sign John McGinn under Brendan Rodgers.
articles.title: 'I still don’t know why' - The £40m Celtic transfer misstep which baffles ex-star and Everton claim

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Scotland get their Euro 2024 qualifying campaign up and running against Cyprus in front of a big crowd at Hampden Park on Saturday afternoon. For manager Steve Clarke there are a number of big decisions to be made from who starts between the sticks to which system the team play.
articles.title: Scotland team to play Cyprus: 5 big decisions for Steve Clarke ahead of opening Euro 2024 qualifier

articles.author: Jamie Gardner
articles.description: A new-look European Super League could have major benefits for Celtic and Rangers, according to the chief executive of the project.
articles.title: Celtic and Rangers could benefit from new European Super League, says project chief

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic Park was a very different place for Mikael Lustig last weekend. And the new perspective offered by detachment left him goggle-eyed.
articles.title: Former Celtic star gets the 'wow' factor during return visit and envies over current player
